person.persName: מוסיא So in the London – BL Harl. 5508 (400), the Munich 6, the Munich 95, the New York JTS Rab 1623\2 (EMC 271) and the St Petersburg RNL Yevr. II A 293/1 Mss, as well as the printed editions. This person was obviously not well known, and his name was not stable so that the scribes of the mss were not sure how to write it, see vol. 4, Introduction 5.1.1.2.1.1, pp. 23-4. This is perhaps the Greek form of this name, translated back into Hebrew, see Introduction 2.2.
/מנסיא So in the New York JTS Rab. 218 (EMC 270) and the Oxford Opp. Add. fol. 23 Mss, see previous note. For this form see vol. 1, Menasiah S-H/M, p. 391.
/מסיא So in the Vatican 134 Ms, see above, n. 2.
person.note: So in the London – BL Harl. 5508 (400), the Munich 6, the Munich 95, the New York JTS Rab 1623\2 (EMC 271) and the St Petersburg RNL Yevr. II A 293/1 Mss, as well as the printed editions. This person was obviously not well known, and his name was not stable so that the scribes of the mss were not sure how to write it, see vol. 4, Introduction 5.1.1.2.1.1, pp. 23-4. This is perhaps the Greek form of this name, translated back into Hebrew, see Introduction 2.2.
So in the New York JTS Rab. 218 (EMC 270) and the Oxford Opp. Add. fol. 23 Mss, see previous note. For this form see vol. 1, Menasiah S-H/M, p. 391.
So in the Vatican 134 Ms, see above, n. 2.
In Aramaic – רבה. On such designations and this tradition see Introduction 3.1.3.1.1.
Although mentioned only here in BT, he is designated רבי (see Introduction 5.1.3.2.2) and he transmits in Hebrew, see Introduction 5.1.3.2.5.
Appears in no chronological context, see Introduction 7.4.4.
